reviews.text: I am still here waiting to go to airport and have had a fantastic 3 nights at this excellent hotel. Excellent service, location, furnishing, cleanliness 5 plus stars all round - although expensive like all Tokyo hotels.

reviews.text: I spent two nights at the Park Hotel with my girlfriend in December 2005. We were very pleased with this hotel. The connection to and from Narita was easy, and the hotel was very modern, clean, friendly and well located at Shidome Station, and a short walk to Shimbashi Station. You can expect to pay unavoidably high Tokyo prices.
reviews.title: Good choice for Tokyo

reviews.text: My wife and I spent two nights at the Park Hotel Tokyo in a Double Room facing Tokyo Tower. We had such a great time! Even prior to our stay, the hotel's concierge assisted me with planning various events including dinner at Iron Chef Hiroyuki Sakai's restaurant. The room is definitely small, but cozy and clean. The view of the Tokyo Tower made up for the smallness of the room. The bed was very comfortable with a down comforter. Free internet access at the business center (with a great view) was a great perk. Using the subway to travel to various sites was very convenient as directions the station were in English. Be sure to bring your coat if your walking to the subway station during winter; the winds gust through the passageways. We would definitely stay here again the next time we are in Tokyo.
reviews.title: Small but very satisfying

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Park hotel for two nights on route to Sydney and found the location to be excellent, easy walking distance to Ginza. The room was spotless although a little small but from other reviews this seems to be common theme in Tokyo. I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Tokyo.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did a two day stopover at the Park Hotel in July. It was excellent. We asked for a non-smoking room and were very pleased with the size of the room. It may have been an up-grade. The bed was king-size. The room was very well appointed and comfortable. The toilet was a delight. Never experienced anything like it. The hotel is close to Ginza and Shimbashi station. The hotel is very tastefully decorated. The lounge area is very quiet and pleasant. The jazz performance at night was a treat. The concierge was very helpful and efficient. The most impressive feature was that the staff were extremely courteous, helpful and well-trained.

So we decided to try out this smaller hotel -- and we couldn't have been more pleased. The service was impeccable, the furnishings were great (rooms are small, but that's just Tokyo in general), and the location was amazing. It's a 5-minute walk to the fish market, so every morning we could have sushi for breakfast. So memorable! Plus the JR line and Metro lines are practically under the hotel.

reviews.text: I would absolutely stay here again.

reviews.text: Good hotel in an excellent location. Very modern design in a triangular tower. Rooms relatively small but clean and adquate, and comparable to Japanese standards. Within 15-20mins walking distance to the Tsukji Fish Market where you can sample fresh sushi from the daily catch. Relatively easy access via either subway or JR rail to other places in Tokyo. I had a JP pass which allowed me unlimited free travel on JR rail. The JR station is slightly complicated to reach if you go underground. The best way is to use the pedestrian walkway on the third floor. About 10-15mins stroll. A map easily obtainable from the reception. Friendly staff and fully recommended.
reviews.title: Excellent stay!

reviews.text: The Park Hotel Tokyo is an oasis in the middle of Tokyo. The room was immaculate, modern and extremely comfortable. The location is excellent - about a 5 min walk to the JR Yamanote line Shimbashi station. The Tokyo subway system can be a little intimidating at first, and the JR Yamanote line was easy to use. We would definitely return.
reviews.title: Once again, perfect!

reviews.text: This is the second year (Spring break) that we stayed at the Park Hotel Tokyo. This time, I requested a West side room overlooking the Tokyo Tower and Mt. Fujii...It was beautiful!

reviews.text: This is a great hotel - spanking clean, wonderful service and great rooms. I selected this hotel based on the wonderful Tripadvisor reviews and I could not have been more pleased. The location is within walking distance of both a JR Station (Shimbashi) on the Yamanote line and a Metro (subway) Station (Shiodome). Check-in was a breeze and we were welcomed when we arrived. The lobby is beautiful and welcoming. Our room had a wonderful view and was larger than I thought it would be. Although not huge - I must say that I have had much smaller rooms in Europe. TV had CNN and BBC for us English speakers and we had Ethernet Internet access in our room. In room safe. An English speaking newspaper was delivered every morning. Breakfast was delicious - croissants absolutely wonderful. Concierge helpful with restaurant and directions (Tsukiji is very close by). It's about 3 minutes to the subway and I would say about 10 minutes to the closest JR station. Both can be reached by the underground pathway system. For those with kiddies, McDonald's in the Caretta Shiodome Building on B2 level is close by as are several wonderful restaurants. We liked Buitoni in the Caretta Shiodome building (B2 level) and also had a very nice meal at China Quick on the B2 level of the Shiodome Media Tower - same building as the hotel. I would stay here again - I wish it was a little closer to a JR station but the walk was fine...
reviews.title: A fantastic hotel and great value for the price!

I feel the room rates are reasonable, I am sure it would be difficult to find a room like this in New York or London at this price. I will most certainly stay at Park Hotel Tokyo again when I am able to return to Tokyo (hopefully soon!).

Park Hotel Tokyo -- just OK
reviews.text: First of all, I did'nt mind the location (which seems to be the largest issue most people have with the hotel). It is within walking distance to Ginza and Shimbashi... and a close station on the Yamamote line (Shimbashi) and a Metro stop (Shiodome -- once you learn how to get to each.

The room I got was really small, even for Tokyo standards...having said that, I did book a standard double. The room was OK, but I would not call it a luxury hotel room (I also stayed at the Granvia in Kyoto which was). Check in was easy. My largest complaint was at check out, where at 6 in the morning there was a line of 3, and only one person behind the desk. I was asked to sit and wait. Soon the person behind the desk left. Finally someone from the back came out to deal with the next customer. He had an issue of thinking he pre-paid, and didnt want to pay again... so that went on and on. It wasnt until I complained to the Bell person that she fished someone else out of the office to check me out. Ahotel like this (which gets the #1 ranking) shouldnt let customers wait like that. We didnt try the hotel restaurants (there are plenty around the area) so I can't comment. All in all, it was OK, perhaps a decent value for the price.
reviews.title: very nice

reviews.text: The Park Hotel is in a different league and so obviosuly the same criteria don't apply, you pay more and so your expectations are greater. We loved the Park Hotel, although as noted in other reviews, the Shidome area was a bit sterile after the lights and action of Roppongi. An easy walk to the Tsukigi fish markets, the Hamarikyu gardens and Ginza and an easy tube up to Ueno park, Akihabara and Asakusa. But the whole walkway above street level among the huge skyscrapers was a bit strange. Have you seen Bladerunner ? The monorail (Yurikamome) out to the Oedo Onsen Monogatori (hot baths) is worth doing as well - the station is just next to the hotel.

As for the hotel, we had a standard double room and had no concerns with size (maybe that is a whole US pre-occupation). Very clean, robes, LCD TV with BBC in English, minibar, in-room safe, toiletries and everthing you could wish for. A heated toilet seat but unlike the B Roppongi, no beer dispensing machine on each floor !! The city view from our room on level 32 was simply spectacular. The staff were excellent, spoke better English than I did, and were extremely helpful. Very good knowledge of the local area which is important. They also allowed us to check-in early and had a room for us at 11am which was great.

Using the hotel's provided maps and directions the property was very easy to find from the JR Yamanote Shimbashi station. Check-in was a breeze. The room size was slightly small but perfectly sized for our needs. The room was very modern and the bathroom decked out with a fancy toilet with all the bells and whistles. A TON of nice toiletry/spa amenities available. For a 2 day stay in Tokyo the hotel couldn't be better located. We were within short walking distance to the Tsukiji Fish Market and Hama Rikyu Garden. Additionally the JR Yamanote line gave us great access to the Shibuya/Harajuku/Shinjuku areas. The hotel staff didn't have a great range of English, but they did go above the call of duty in one case. I bought an int'l/domestic calling card from the lobby and tried to make a call to a local cell using the card but upon help from the concierge I learned the card I bought couldn't call local cells in Japan. He was kind enough to let me use his cell phone to call my friend - a huge help. Just a note that most US cell phones don't work in Japan as apparently they are on a different network. We had a 9am flight to Beijing on our final morning and the concierge wasn't really able to help us arrange travel to the airport other than recommending the T-CAT since the airport limo bus did not run early enough for us to get to the airport by 7am - again, lost in translation. Upon recommendation from our friend we were able to take the JR Yamanote to the Keisei line at Akihabara and make it to the airport in under an hour. Thanks to all for the great feedback - this hotel was an awesome find!

reviews.text: LOCATION
reviews.title: Brilliant for the money

reviews.text: The hotel is right near the Shimbashi station. Not really knowing how to get there from the NRT airport, we took a bus, but it took an hour and a half due to the number of stops along the way. You can buy a Japan Rail Pass prior (this is good if you are traveling to other cities in Japan. We used it to travel from Tokyo to Kyoto -- you purchase the exchange order outside of Japan, and then get the Rail Pass once you arrive). With the rail pass, you can take the metro to Tokyo Station, and a cab to the hotel from Tokyo Station is not that expensive (by tokyo standards). The hotel is also walking distance to Ginza and the Tsukiji fish market. Underneath the hotel area is a mall or restaurant area -- we discovered it on our last night, and it had a lot of restaurants. perfect if you are getting in around the evening and don't want to travel far for dinner. Can't remember exactly where or what it was called b/c it's been a few months, but the hotel staff should know.

reviews.text: Park Hotel is located in Shimbasi,which reminds you of the Dockland,London but without the water.New area with high rise buildings and restaurants located at ground floors.Hotel was very easy to get to from Tokyo station, we took the JR line to Shimbasi and took the exit signposted Shimbasi exit.Walk across to an overground covered walkway (also lift available for those suitcases) and follow the walkway literally to the Hotel.It is a 7min walk.The walkway is safe,just like the rest of Tokyo.The hotel was very stylish and modern and you get complimentary pyjamas and slippers.The staff very courteous and friendly and reception area has a fine view of Mount Fuji on a clear day as its located on the 25th floor.Shimbasi is located next to Ginza which is the shopping district so we didn't find a 10 minute walk tedious at all.Not like some of the reviews.Would definitley stay there again.

reviews.text: What a great hotel! We stayed here the end of December while touring Japan for three days before heading south. After an eleven hour flights and a two hour shuttle bus ride to the hotel we got to the hotel late and when we got up the the lobby were immediately greeted with a beautiful view of Tokyo Tower and jazz music from the lounge. The staff were all very helpful and most spoke english fairly well. I have to say the shampoo they give you is some of the best I've used and had a very good hair day with it. So much so that I ordered more from Tokyo after I got back to the States. All in all the bed was comfortable, the drinks in the bar were excellent, everyone was friendly and courteous and the view was unbeatable.

reviews.title: Highly recommended
reviews.text: We stayed at the Park Hotel for 3 nights en route to New Zealand and would highly recommend it. As others have noted, the location is excellent for public transport, including the Yurikomome monorail that goes out to the Odaiba waterfront area - a day ticket is well worth buying for 800 yen to hop on and off and explore this area (spectacular views back to the City at night, too).

Many others have mentioned the 'small' rooms; we found our room perfectly adequate and, certainly, well designed - in fact, the whole hotel is stylish and comfortable. Breakfasts are easily bought from one of a number of coffee shops nearby and on our first night at the hotel, being pretty exhausted, we ate in the restaurant and did not consider our simple, but good, pasta dish too highly priced.
